required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Nutritional Status of Residents From the Chinese National Health and Nutrition Survey During 2010-2012

lead_sponsor.agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, China

clinical_study.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, China

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, we analyzed the nutritional status of Chinese residents aged above 6y. The indicators such as the hemoglobin, vitamin D, vitamin A and TG, TC and HDLC were also included. Related risk factors (such as age, region type, ethnicity, bodyweight, height, education, season, smoke habit, etc).

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
through study completion, an average of 1 year
through study completion, an average of 1 year
through study completion, an average of 1 year

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participanted in China national nutrition and health survey (CNNHS) 2010-2012; Aged above 6 years old; Had blood taken;
Exclusion Criteria:
- No.

reference.citation: GBD 2015 Disease and Injury Incidence and Prevalence Collaborators. Global, regional, and national incidence, prevalence, and years lived with disability for 310 diseases and injuries, 1990-2015: a systematic analysis for the Global Burden of Disease Study 2015. Lancet. 2016 Oct 8;388(10053):1545-1602. doi: 10.1016/S0140-6736(16)31678-6. Erratum in: Lancet. 2017 Jan 7;389(10064):e1.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, China
responsible_party.investigator_title: National Institute for Nutrition and Health

clinical_study.keyword: hemoglobin, vitamin D, vitamin A, TC, TG, HDLC
